desc: Hello,I'm the Founder of a company named TLC, a start up based in London, UK and I will be heading out to New York this week (29th - 6th) and I am looking for a videographer. I'm looking for a half day videographer to come around the city with me, no editing required. The most important factor is that you have both a passion and skill for conveying emotion through videos, reasoning below!A little about the company:The Lion’s Club (TLC) is on a mission to create the world’s first “go to” community of inspiring individuals and to share their stories with organisations’ employees to create an inspirational, motivated and resilient work place. TLC acts as an intermediary between organisations and the inspiring individuals (the “Lions”), who have all faced times of challenge in their lives and are passionate about sharing their experiences and how they have overcome them with others.My inspiration behind TLC comes from losing my own father in May 2015 when I was 23. My father was murdered whilst on a business trip and I have since been on my own journey and have now decided to step up, share my story and empower others to do so too, in order to inspire those currently in the midst of their own challenge.The company will be launched in the UK in January 2018. The video will be mostly filmed in the UK and edited in London but I need assistance in creating some shots over in NY. The video will be broken down into half about me and my life and then moving on to my motivation for launching TLC before finally talking about TLC. The video will be showing a range of emotions, in the order of the audience being engaged, shocked, saddened, supportive and finally wanting to be involved.Please reach out directly with your quote and a few ideas of shots in NY that would help me convey those emotions :-)Look forward to working with you next week!Gian
title: Half day videographer for Start-Up video launch

desc: We already have a final model of the Body with us. We just need a few parts to be modelled and textured and a few parts to be edited on the current model itself. We are working with Autodesk Maya 2015. We have all the references ready (images, videos and pdfs of corrections to be made) for every part, which will be shared on Google Drive. The other parts of the current model should not be altered in any way. Only the parts mentioned should be worked on.The project files can only be sent on Monday 27th November 2017. You can refer to the uploaded images to get an idea of the project. There is a sample of the model, PDF correction files and a sample of the texturing that is needed.The quality standard should be approved by us in order for the project to be completed. Any changes to the parts mentioned will not incur any additional charges.Amount: Rs.3500Time: Minimum 2 DaysHere are the details for this project:STRUCTURESA) Structures to be Modelled & Textured:*Category: Head and Face1. Sinus Cavities in Skull*Category: Neck —> Larynx Cartilages1. Cuneiform CartilagesB) Structures that need editing on Current Model*Category: Neck —> Larynx Cartilages1. Corniculate CartilagesMUSCLESA) Muscles to be Modelled & Textured:*Category: Neck —> Larynx Extrinsic Muscles1. Genioglossus Muscles2. Hyoglossus Muscles3. Omohyoid Muscles*Category: Neck —> Larynx Intrinsic Muscles1. Cricothyroid Muscles*Category: Lower Torso —> Pelvic Muscles1. Levator Ani Muscles2. Coccyges Muscles*Category: Back1. Splenius Capitis Muscles2. Iliocostalis Muscles3. Longissimus MusclesB) Muscles that need editing on Current Model*Category: Head and Face1. Tongue*Category: Neck —> Larynx Vocal Folds1. True Vocal Folds2. False Vocal Folds*Category: Neck —> Larynx Intrinsic Muscles1. Internal Thyroarytenoid Muscles or Vocalis Muscles2. Posterior Cricoarytenoid Muscles3. Aryepiglottic MusclesCombined Total Parts:Modelling & Texturing: 1 Structure + 9 Muscles = 10 PartsEditing on Current Model: 1 Structure + 6 Muscles = 7 Parts
title: 3D Modelling and Texturing in Autodesk Maya 2015

desc: HelloI am interested in doing a 1-2 minute animated music video with a story....For instance it could be for my song "Bandida"...or "Takata" or maybe both...We could create a 1-2 minute animated story probably 2d because i need it done within the next 30 days...Unless a simple 3d could be put together...Then we would chop it up into segments and combine it with live performances and such...Later we could think about doing a series using the same characters or a video game?I have a $1,000 to $2,000 budget for this project...do you think we can do it?What do you think?How hard would it be to create a short 1 minute video like this one in the links below...What software do you think they used? It appears that some of the animation links below use the DAZ software.The DAZ software seems to be very good at creating life like animation…..Can Maya also do that? I believe the models are already made and you just animate them?The links below are very cool because they are so life like...all of them use this "Daz" Software...i don't know what that is..I think if we could do something like this ..it would be fine for a music video...I would prefer that the video look something like the links below…if it is not too much work…[url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view]This one below is also pretty cool...might be to complicated to create a music video in a months time using this kind of animation?[url removed, login to view]This one below is pretty cool.[url removed, login to view]Would this one below be less work to create since is appears to be 2d?[url removed, login to view]This one below is a little different...2d? or what is it[url removed, login to view]
title: I need an animator

title: m1st AE videos

desc: Hello,I am searching for someone who is able to create five animations for me:(1) The universe - black, but full of stars; far away in the distance a light spot gets slowly bigger until it explodes over the screen into multiple colors (a reference: [url removed, login to view] ; its from the film "Under the skin" and its kind of the direction, but not exactly of course - I need more colors for example) - 8-10 seconds(2) The same camera angle. What has been the light spot is now a drifting cloud of light (somewhat like the photo that I uploaded). In addition to this shot, I will film tentacles in front of a green screen. You will have to compose this material into the cgi shot, so that the tentacles come out of the distance (out of the cloud of light) - 4 seconds(3) The tentacles are closer to the camera now (apart from that it is the same shot like before) - 3 seconds(4) The tentacles cling round the cloud of light (I am thinking about filming the tentacles in front of a green screen and let them cling around a balloon - what do you think?); the cloud is pulsating and gets smaller - 4 seconds(5) Its kind of number (1) but in reverse: The cloud of light becomes a little spot again and then disappears totally in the blackness of the universe. - 6 seconds (but it would be cool if I got some more material of this shot - of the black universe with the stars -, so that i can roll the credits over it)Feel free to ask me anything, let's brainstorm about the effects and how we can create really bizarr images - out of this world so to say.
title: 3D-animations for a short-horror-sci-fi-film (light explosion in space)
